roleset.name: woo

example.name: I hope this is metaphorical
example.text: At the Laurel race track, the breeders are romancing people like Tim Hulings, a beer packaging plant worker.
example.arg: people like Tim Hulings, a beer packaging plant worker.

roleset.note: ROMANCE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'romance' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from romance.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: idealized (but not pertaining to amour)

example.name: both args
example.text: The idea was very romantic to me, being that Pink Floyd had such an impact on my childhood, even though I am not overly familiar with the music of Vera Lynn herself.
example.arg: being that Pink Floyd had such an impact on my childhood,
even though I am not overly familiar with the music of Vera Lynn herself.

roleset.note: ROMANTIC-J NOTES: Added by Julia. Relation to romanticize.01. (from romantic.02-j)

roleset.name: amorous, pertaining to romance

role.descr: romancer (may be animate, inanimate, or actions)

example.name: verbal rel:
example.text: I watched attentively as Perry Como and Dean Martin songs romanced her through the speakers.
example.arg: Perry Como and Dean Martin songs

example.name: arg0
example.text: If need be I can throw it out tonight . But it 's not very romantic .

roleset.note: ROMANTIC-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. Relation to (from romantic.01-j)

roleset.name: fit to a romantic ideal

example.name: not nice adjectival
example.text: Much of Mr. Lane's film takes a highly romanticized view of life on the streets (though probably no more romanticized than Mr. Chaplin's notion of the Tramp as the good-hearted free spirit).
example.arg: view of life on the streets

roleset.note: ROMANTICIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'romanticize' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from romanticize.01-v predicate notes)
